Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2013 05:13AM MarisaKaye72 wrote: Thank you everyone.  My excision biopsy is scheduled for September 24th.  I will look into the genetic counseling.  About eight years ago, I saw a specialist who did genetic testing (BRCA)on my mother.  My mother did not have the BC gene.  At the time, my insurance would not pay for me to be tested.   Momof4bless, I hope you get an appointment soon.  My appointment was scheduled relatively fast.  My annual physical was last Monday as well as my mammogram and ultrasound.  I saw the surgeon yesterday and I am scheduled for the biopsy next week.  It still seems to be moving in slow motion.  I am somewhat comforted that he said it doesn't "feel" like cancer.
Posts.Title: Lump that doesn't show on mammogram or ultrasound MarisaKaye72 MarisaKaye72

Posts.Content: Sep 18, 2013 10:05PM MarisaKaye72 wrote: As I am sure you all can understand, I can't stop thinking about this.  I remembered this morning that about six months ago I fell pretty hard and I hit my breast on a printer here in the office.  It was bruised very badly but I don't remember feeling anything in it all after the bruising went  away.  Now I have this lump six months later.  Could it just be damaged tissue.  Should I call the doctor and tell him before we go ahead with the biopsy?
Posts.Title: Lump that doesn't show on mammogram or ultrasound MarisaKaye72 MarisaKaye72
